com.fujitsu.xml.xbrl.inlinexbrl.generator
Class ContinuationTagging

java.lang.Object
  com.fujitsu.xml.xbrl.inlinexbrl.generator.InlineXBRLTagging
      com.fujitsu.xml.xbrl.inlinexbrl.generator.ContinuationTagging

public class ContinuationTagging
extends InlineXBRLTagging

Tagging information for the ix:continuation element to an XHTML node.

This class can be used during generation of Inline XBRL 1.1 documents via InlineXBRLGenerator2.

After processing this tagging, all the XHTML nodes between the specified start XHTML node and end XHTML node will be embraced by the ix:continuation element. The following attributes will be set to the ix:continuation element. The id attribute is automatically generated in such a way as it has a unique value a given Inline XBRL document. As for the continuedAt attribute, if another ix:continuation element is connected to this ix:continuation element, the latter id atttribute value is set to continuedAt attribute.

Since:
13.6

ContinuationTagging

public ContinuationTagging(org.w3c.dom.Node startNode,
                           org.w3c.dom.Node endNode)

Constructs ContinuationTagging multiple XHTML nodes.
startNode and endNode must satisfy the following conditions:

  • startNode and endNode belong to the same parent node
  • endNode is after startNode

Parameters:
startNode - start XHTML node
endNode - end XHTML node
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if startNode or endNode is null.
